description: Cedecea lapagei is a species of bacteria that belongs to the family Enterobacteriaceae. It is a Gram-negative, rod-shaped, and motile bacterium. Cedecea lapagei is an opportunistic pathogen that has been isolated from various clinical samples, including wounds, urine, and blood, particularly in immunocompromised individuals. This species is known to exhibit resistance to multiple antibiotics, which can make it challenging to treat infections caused by this bacterium. Cedecea lapagei is a relatively rare and understudied species, and further research is needed to understand its epidemiology, virulence factors, and clinical significance.
